text:
Building Hopes

A dim room, a woman knitting, worried expression.  
She thinks: “Can I count on his generosity?”  

Mother: “I shall refuse!”  
Dounia: “But what else do we have?”  

---  

A street scene, a man dressed sharply, smug.  
She thinks: “Will he wear his medals?”  

She: “He’ll press it on me.”  
Dounia: “Hope for the best, right?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrator expresses skepticism about Dounia's engagement to Mr. Luzhin, doubting his generosity and questioning her ability to endure his character.
